title: Ethereum message handling fails in private proof-of-authority testnet when serving light clients
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.8.15`
OS & Version: OSX 10.13.6

#### Expected behaviour
In a locally running testnet with two proof-of-authority nodes, the nodes should alternate sealing blocks while staying connected to each other.

#### Actual behaviour
The two nodes continually connect and disconnect, setting a block time floor of `dialHistoryExpiration`:

```

INFO [08-30|17:31:29.528] Successfully sealed new block            number=19 sealhash=eb1060â€¦846949 hash=545642â€¦825261 elapsed=1.052ms
```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Use puppeth to configure a genesis block using `Clique - proof-of-authority` and two sealers.  Populate `datadir0/keystore` and `datadir1/keystore` with the keystore of the two sealers.
Run:
```
geth init genesis.json --datadir datadir0 && echo $PASSWORD0 | --nodiscover --datadir datadir0 --unlock $SEALER0 --etherbase $SEALER0 --networkid $NETWORK_ID  --rpc --rpcapi 'eth,web3,net,admin,personal,miner' --rpcport 8545 --port 30303 --verbosity 5 --lightserv 90 --lightpeers 20
```

and then run:
```
geth init genesis.json --datadir datadir1 && echo $PASSWORD1 | --nodiscover --datadir datadir0 --unlock $SEALER0 --etherbase $SEALER1 --networkid $NETWORK_ID  --rpc --rpcapi 'eth,web3,net,admin,personal,miner' --rpcport 8547 --port 30305 --verbosity 5 --lightserv 90 --lightpeers 20
```

then:
```
geth attach http://localhost:8545
> admin.addPeer('$ENODE_1`)
> miner.start()
```

and finally:
```
geth attach http://localhost:8547
> miner.start()
```

Got the same problem on geth v1.9.0 unstable.
Here: https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/questions/65390/light-ethereum-message-handling-failed-eof-error

Regarding the original report, there was indeed a problem where two LES servers would reject eachother, since as far as LES was concerned, they were not interested in each other. Now, that's problematic, because from the ETH perspective, they _need_ to be able to talk if they are to exchange clique blocks. 
This is supposedly fixed. 

As for the second issue, we can't really know if it's the same -- it appears to be something different. @reardenlife please file a new ticket, if this reappears (I saw on stackexchange that you managed to get around it)
Apparently it was not fixed. Now it is fixed by https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/20453
